chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest Walker Holley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ernest Walker Holley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ernest Walker Holley was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated
May serve in Dane Co. on ATIP/JAIP/EMP.

Provide DNA sample unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent include AODA.  Not to operate m/v w/o valid DL and consent of agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Commence on or before Nov. 28, 2014 unless agent states otherwise.
Consecutive to: to any other w/o good time

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  May transfer to any other county if approved by both counties.  Fines,costs & restitution to be thru huber wages and any unpaid upon release to be civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest Walker Holley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DE and answer response from public defender

Defendant Ernest Walker Holley in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Ernest Walker Holley in custody.  Denny Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and defense have received and reviewed the revocation summary and the letter from defendant.  Defendant is prepared to proceed to sentencing today.  Matter is agreed upon.  Attorney ORourke states agreement reached.  12 months Sauk County Jail, with Huber privileges.  Previously ordered fines, costs & restitution .  Attorney ORourke gives explanation for joint agreement.  Support statement given.  State agrees and makes final statement.  Attorney ORourke makes final statement.  Defendant makes final statement to the court.  Court imposes:
12 months Sauk County Jail, with Huber privileges.  125 days credit.  Consecutive to any other sentences.   Transfer to any other county approved, per court rules.  
Fines, costs & restitution to be paid from Huber wages.  
Any unpaid fines, costs & restitution at release to be converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 09-14-2015 10:30 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-17-2015 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-25-2015 03:00 pm

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ernest Walker Holley in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Atty Lawton agrees and waives DE's right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Lawton acknowledges rec. information/waives reading.  Court reads charges/max penalties from information to DE.  Atty Lawton enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Atty Lawton makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
Probation for 24 months
Conditions of probation:
90 days jail w/huber but w/o good time consecutive to any other sentence
May serve in Dane Co on ATIP/JAIP/EMP if approved
To commence on or before 11/28/2014 at 6:30 pm unless agent directs otherwise
EMP approved per jail rules and per agent
$516.00 costs to be paid during term of probation per agent
DNA sample to be provided unless that has been done previously in other matters
$793.22 to SCSD and 10% surcharges to be paid during term of probation per agent (restitution paid in full already)
To be deducted from huber account at 25%
AODA/Treatment/Counseling/Evaluations per agent
24 days sentence credit only if probation is revoked
Ct 2:  Dismissed
Ct 3:  Dismissed
Return date on September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ernest Walker Holley in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits waived to hold a preliminary hearing.  Reset for RD and will do informal PTC.  Return date scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Ernest Walker Holley appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Linda A. Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived. State requests $1000.00 Cash bail and states prior warrants.  Atty. Woodard requests PA bond or modest bond.  Court sets $900.00 CASH bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 11:30 am.
